requirement_tested: Frontend application with dynamic data fetching from backend APIs
user_persona: A student named Alex who wants to explore available data science courses.
user_goal: To view the list of available Python data science courses loaded dynamically from the backend.

narrative_steps.title: Visiting Homepage
narrative_steps.description: Alex opens the learning platform homepage expecting to see a list of courses fetched live from the server.
narrative_steps.action: Load the homepage URL in browser.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The frontend app initializes and sends an API request to /api/v1/courses to fetch course data.

narrative_steps.title: Displaying Courses Dynamically
narrative_steps.description: As the data arrives, Alex expects the course cards to populate automatically without needing a refresh.
narrative_steps.action: Receive response from backend API with course data.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Course cards render dynamically on the page showing titles, descriptions, and thumbnails retrieved via API.

requirement_tested: Backend application connecting to PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables
user_persona: A developer named Taylor deploying the backend service locally.
user_goal: Ensure the backend connects properly to the PostgreSQL database using predefined environment variables.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Backend Server
narrative_steps.description: Taylor runs the backend server and verifies that it uses correct database credentials from environment variables.
narrative_steps.action: Start the Node.js Express server with DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, etc. set.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Server logs confirm successful connection to PostgreSQL instance at localhost:5432 with myapp database.

narrative_steps.title: Fetching Data from Database
narrative_steps.description: Taylor triggers a sample API call to verify real-time data retrieval from connected database.
narrative_steps.action: Make GET request to /api/v1/courses endpoint.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Response returns actual course records stored in the PostgreSQL database under 'myapp' schema.

user_persona: A registered user Mia trying to access her enrolled courses.
user_goal: Log in securely and gain access to protected course materials.

narrative_steps.title: Logging In
narrative_steps.description: Mia enters her credentials into the login form and submits them to authenticate.
narrative_steps.action: Fill out email and password fields and click Submit.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: System validates credentials and returns a JWT token saved in localStorage; Mia is redirected to her dashboard.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Protected Content
narrative_steps.description: Mia attempts to visit a course page that requires authentication.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate directly to a course detail page URL requiring authentication.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Request includes Authorization header with valid JWT; Mia gains access to the course content without redirection.

requirement_tested: Course browsing interface displaying available Python data science courses
user_persona: A prospective learner Jordan exploring different courses.
user_goal: Browse through various Python data science courses using filters and search options.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Initial Course List
narrative_steps.description: Jordan lands on the course catalog page where he sees a grid of course cards.
narrative_steps.action: Load the course catalog page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A responsive grid of course cards loads showing titles, thumbnails, and difficulty levels fetched from backend.

narrative_steps.title: Filtering by Difficulty Level
narrative_steps.description: Jordan wants to find only intermediate-level courses, so he selects the filter dropdown.
narrative_steps.action: Select 'Intermediate' from the difficulty level dropdown.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Page updates dynamically to show only Intermediate-level Python data science courses.

user_persona: A student named Noah interested in enrolling in a new course.
user_goal: Enroll in a desired Python data science course and begin learning immediately.

narrative_steps.title: Choosing a Course
narrative_steps.description: Noah finds a suitable course and clicks the 'Enroll Now' button on its card.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Enroll Now' button on a course card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: POST request sent to /api/v1/enrollments creates an enrollment record; success notification appears.

narrative_steps.title: Continuing Learning
narrative_steps.description: Noah revisits the same course page later, now expecting to continue where he left off.
narrative_steps.action: Revisit the previously enrolled course page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Instead of 'Enroll Now', a 'Continue Learning' button is displayed and redirects to lesson modules.

requirement_tested: Learning content delivery system for enrolled courses
user_persona: A dedicated learner Emma studying course material.
user_goal: Watch video lessons and read markdown-based content seamlessly within the course module.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating Lessons
narrative_steps.description: Emma clicks a lesson item from the sidebar to switch between lessons quickly.
narrative_steps.action: Click a lesson link in the sidebar navigation.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Lesson content loads dynamically in the main panel without reloading the entire page.

narrative_steps.title: Completing a Video Lesson
narrative_steps.description: After watching a full video lesson, Emma expects automatic progress tracking.
narrative_steps.action: Watch the entire duration of a video lesson.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Lesson marked as completed and progress tracker increments accordingly in the database.

requirement_tested: Assignment submission interface for course assignments
user_persona: A diligent student Liam preparing to submit his assignment.
user_goal: Upload his Jupyter notebook file and confirm successful submission.

narrative_steps.title: Uploading Assignment File
narrative_steps.description: Liam drags and drops his .ipynb file into the designated upload zone.
narrative_steps.action: Drag and drop a .ipynb file onto the assignment upload area.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: File uploads successfully and the Submit button becomes enabled.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting Assignment
narrative_steps.description: Once uploaded, Liam clicks the Submit button to finalize his work.
narrative_steps.action: Click the Submit button after uploading the assignment file.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Solution submitted to backend at /api/v1/assignments/{id}/submit; confirmation toast appears.

requirement_tested: Grade querying dashboard for users to view their learning grades
user_persona: A curious student Olivia checking her performance metrics.
user_goal: Review her submitted assignments and export grade report as CSV.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Grade Dashboard
narrative_steps.description: Olivia navigates to her grade dashboard to review scores of past assignments.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the grade dashboard via user menu or direct URL.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Dashboard displays tabular view of assignments with score details and visual chart of performance trend.

narrative_steps.title: Exporting Grades
narrative_steps.description: She decides to download a copy of her grades for offline analysis.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Export Grades' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Browser prompts to download a CSV file containing all her grade records.

requirement_tested: Database schema supporting users, courses, enrollments, assignments, and grades
user_persona: A system administrator named Sam validating database integrity.
user_goal: Verify that all necessary tables exist and relationships are correctly modeled.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Table Structure
narrative_steps.description: Sam connects to the PostgreSQL database and checks the presence of required tables.
narrative_steps.action: Connect to PostgreSQL database and inspect table schemas.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Tables named users, courses, enrollments, assignments, and grades exist with proper column definitions.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Foreign Key Relationships
narrative_steps.description: Sam ensures foreign keys are correctly mapped across related tables.
narrative_steps.action: Examine foreign key constraints among tables like enrollments.user_id -> users.id.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Foreign key references are accurate, maintaining referential integrity throughout the schema.

requirement_tested: Responsive UI design with honeydew background and dark olive green components
user_persona: A mobile user Zoe accessing the platform on her smartphone.
user_goal: Experience consistent styling and layout adaptation across devices.

narrative_steps.title: Loading Site on Mobile Device
narrative_steps.description: Zoe opens the platform on her phone and notices how colors adapt to screen size.
narrative_steps.action: Open site on mobile device with <768px width.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Site displays stacked layout with hamburger menu; background remains honeydew and buttons appear dark olive green.

narrative_steps.title: Resizing Browser Window
narrative_steps.description: Zoe resizes her browser window to simulate different screen sizes.
narrative_steps.action: Resize browser window from small to large dimensions.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Layout transitions smoothly between mobile, tablet, and desktop views while retaining consistent color scheme.

requirement_tested: Package.json configuration with npm run install:all for frontend and backend installation
user_persona: A new contributor named Drew setting up the project locally.
user_goal: Install dependencies for both frontend and backend using a single command.

narrative_steps.title: Running Install Command
narrative_steps.description: Drew clones the repository and runs the unified install script.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run install:all` in root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both client and server folders execute `npm install` concurrently installing all required packages.

requirement_tested: Package.json configuration with npm run dev for concurrent frontend and backend development servers
user_persona: Developer Riley starting daily development session.
user_goal: Launch both frontend and backend development environments simultaneously.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: Riley wants to develop both parts together and runs the concurrent dev command.
narrative_steps.action: Execute `npm run dev` in the root folder.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Concurrently starts React dev server (port 3000) and Node.js backend server (port 5000) in parallel.

requirement_tested: API endpoints for course management and retrieval
user_persona: An admin user named Casey managing course offerings.
user_goal: Retrieve and manage course listings using RESTful API endpoints.

narrative_steps.title: Retrieving Paginated Course List
narrative_steps.description: Casey wants to retrieve a paginated list of all courses using the API.
narrative_steps.action: Send GET request to /api/v1/courses?page=1&limit=10.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Returns first 10 courses along with metadata about total count and pagination info.

narrative_steps.title: Searching for Specific Course
narrative_steps.description: Casey searches for a specific course by keyword using query parameters.
narrative_steps.action: Send GET request to /api/v1/courses?search=Python.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Only courses matching the keyword 'Python' are returned in the response.

requirement_tested: API endpoints for assignment submission and grade reporting
user_persona: Student Riley submitting an assignment programmatically.
user_goal: Use API to submit an assignment and then retrieve grade feedback.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting Assignment via API
narrative_steps.description: Riley prepares a payload with code snippet and submits it to the assignment endpoint.
narrative_steps.action: POST to /api/v1/assignments/{id}/submit with body { "code": "print('Hello World')" }.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Submission accepted by server and recorded in database; returns success status.

narrative_steps.title: Retrieving Personal Grades
narrative_steps.description: Later, Riley checks his personal grade report using the grades endpoint.
narrative_steps.action: GET request to /api/v1/users/me/grades.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Returns JSON array of assignment grades including score, max score, and submission dates.

requirement_tested: User dashboard for managing enrolled courses and tracking progress
user_persona: Active learner Ava monitoring her study progress.
user_goal: Track enrolled courses and upcoming deadlines from centralized dashboard.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Dashboard Post-Login
narrative_steps.description: After logging in, Ava lands on her personalized dashboard to check current status.
narrative_steps.action: Log in and navigate to dashboard.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Dashboard loads sections like 'My Courses', 'Upcoming Deadlines', and circular progress indicators.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Enrolled Courses
narrative_steps.description: Ava clicks the 'My Courses' section to get an overview of her ongoing studies.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'My Courses' card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Redirected to a filtered course listing showing only enrolled courses with highlighted resume points.
